AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: The only visible AI content is the standard greeting/intake prompt. There is no AI troubleshooting response to evaluate as wrong/misleading, and no customer feedback indicating the AI was unhelpful.
evidence: AI: "Please select from the below or give me a detailed description of what’s happening. Any error messages you’ve seen or steps you’ve already tried would be really helpful."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: No evidence of repeated AI prompts, repeated requests for the same info, or the customer asking for a human and being kept in an AI loop. The log shows a single AI intake followed by the customer's initial problem statement (truncated).
evidence: Customer: "After updating to ME 22.2 the outlook spam handler ...[truncated]..."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: There is not enough conversation shown to demonstrate that support ignored previously provided details or re-asked for information already supplied. The customer’s description is truncated and there are no subsequent support replies visible.
evidence: Customer: "After updating to ME 22.2 the outlook spam handler ...[truncated]..."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: Only one timestamped interaction block is shown, and there is no follow-up message or gap between customer message and support response visible to measure a delay.

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: No ticket status/closure event is shown, and there is no indication the ticket was closed while an open question remained. The excerpt only includes the start of the interaction and a truncated customer message.
evidence: Log ends after the initial customer statement: "After updating to ME 22.2 the outlook spam handler ...[truncated]..."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The visible text does not establish a confirmed high-severity outage (e.g., production down/all users blocked) nor show support handling that urgency inappropriately. The customer’s issue description is truncated and severity is unclear.
